entities.description: The image depicts the BookIndex Construction process, showing Tree Construction from Layout Parsing and Section Filtering, as well as Graph Construction involving KG Construction and Gradient-based Entity Resolution.
The stage in the BookIndex Construction process where the layout of text, tables, images, and titles is parsed to create tree nodes.
The stage following Layout Parsing where sections are filtered based on specific parameters such as level and type.
The process of constructing a tree from the parsed layout data. It relies on the analysis of text, titles, tables, and images.
The method that involves creating a graph using KG Construction followed by Gradient-based Entity Resolution.
The first step in Graph Construction, which involves building a knowledge graph from the tree nodes derived from Layout Parsing.
The second step in Graph Construction, which uses gradient-based techniques to perform entity matching and merging.
Representations or components of the document content, visually depicted as individual entities in the graphical description.
A phase for evaluating the similarity and deciding if two entities should match during the gradient-based entity resolution process.
Action taken after successful matching using gradient-based entity resolution to combine or merge related entities.
The final representation of the document content derived from the entire BookIndex Construction process.
A label within the section filtering phase that specifies the associated text or content as a method with a font size of 14.
A label indicating experimental content with a font size of 14, presented in the section filtering phase.
A section title with a specified font size of 20 in the section filtering phase.
